author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Gulf Air Hosts Ramadan Iftar in BeirutTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Gulf Air hosts Ramadan Iftar in Beirut
Gulf Air, the national carrier of the Kingdom of Bahrain, recently hosted an iftar in Beirut in celebration of the spirit of the holy month of Ramadan with key trade partners. The event, held in Frida Restaurant in Ashrafieh, was attended by a number of travel agents and trade representatives in Beirut and was hosted by Gulf Air’s Sales Manager for Gulf Air in Lebanon, Mrs. Amale Choueiry.
Speaking at the event Mrs. Amale Choueiry said: “We are delighted to host our partners for an iftar as we celebrate the holy month of Ramadan. This is an opportunity for us to thank our trade associates for the support they continue to show Gulf Air and we look forward to further strengthening our ties and achieving new milestones as we continue to work towards providing travel opportunities between Lebanon, Bahrain and the greater GCC region.”
Gulf Air’s annual Ramadan events in Beirut have served to further strengthen the airline’s ties with key industry stakeholders, reinforcing the longstanding relationship between Bahrain’s national carrier and the Lebanese Republic and its importance as a key destination for the airline. Currently, Gulf Air operates 9 weekly flights between Beirut and Bahrain during the summer travel season. Boasting one of the Middle East’s largest networks, Gulf Air is well-positioned to connect Beirut to several key destinations in the Middle East, Asia and Europe with excellent connectivity via its efficient Bahrain International Airport hub.
